item_blurb: Public comments will be heard at 9:00 am for items not on the agenda, for no more than 30 minutes. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers will be given up to 3 minutes. For those unable to attend the early comment period, there may be additional comment time available later in the day. Note: Comments made during the general public comment period regarding matters pending before the Commission do not become part of the official record for those matters.

(PF/SS-SF)

subitem_title: Permit No. A-2-MAR-08-028-A2 (Lawson’s Landing Inc., Marin Co.)
subitem_blurb: Request by Lawson’s Landing Inc. to amend permit to: 1) construct wastewater management system, including collection, treatment and dispersal facilities; 2) improve existing entrance, gate house, roadway and parking facilities; 3) construct Lawson’s Landing Center including new support service buildings, store, electric vehicle charging station, and rooftop photovoltaic or solar thermal collectors; and 4) restore habitat, at Lawson’s Landing facility, at 137 Marine View Dr. south of Dillon Beach, Marin County. (JM-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. A-3-MCO-09-009 (Rancho Los Robles Subdivision, North Monterey Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of Heritage/Western Communities LTD to: 1) subdivide 2 parcels totaling 33.58 acres into 52 residential lots; 2) demolish single-family home, 2 barns, and remove 2 mobile home units; 3) construct 54 residences, including 50 single-family residences and 4 units in duplexes; 4) dedicate 3.5 acres of land to Monterey County for future parks and recreational facilities; 5) dedicate 17 acres of land and one existing single-family home to future to-be-formed Community Services District for future parks and recreational facilities; and 6) construct roads and related improvements, at 100 Sill Rd., Las Lomas, North Monterey County. (KK-SC)

item_title: Items Th18.1 & 18.2, below will be heard as a combined hearing and staff report.
Consent Cease and Desist Order No. CCC-17-CD-03
item_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed administrative order directing property owners to: 1) remove unpermitted development from; and 2) cease and desist from undertaking additional unpermitted development, including: installation and maintenance of 37 water wells, grading and vegetation removal for roads, “discing” at Cojo Marine Terminal, landform alteration associated with redesign of 3 stock ponds, fill of riparian area, and installation of various hard structures such as riprap and concrete spillway, on; portions of approx. 24,364 acre property now known as Cojo Jalama Ranches (formerly known as the Bixby Ranch), at 10000 Jalama Rd.; and 3) resolve civil liabilities. (HDJ/ANM-SF)

Public hearing and Commission action on proposed administrative order directing property owners to: 1) take restorative actions, including: removal, erosion control, remedial grading, and revegetation activities; 2) provide additional enhancement and protection of coastal resources on property and surrounding areas to address temporal losses of habitat; and 3) implement long-term monitoring program; to address unpermitted development, including: installation and maintenance of 37 water wells, grading and vegetation removal for roads, “discing” at Cojo Marine Terminal, landform alteration associated with redesign of 3 stock ponds, fill of riparian area, and installation of various hard structures such as riprap and concrete spillway; on portions of approx. 24,364 acre property now known as Cojo Jalama Ranches (formerly known as Bixby Ranch), at 10000 Jalama Rd.; and 4) resolve civil liabilities. (HDJ/ANM -SF)
